text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with instant mashed potato pancakes
i know sounds kind of crazy but I had
the end of a box of instant mashed
potatoes in my pantry and you know I
don't want that thing sitting around so
I thought I could make an instant mashed
potato pancake that would be crispy
crunchy on the outside soft tender and
tastes like fresh mashed potatoes on the
inside and here's how it went alright so
I'm going to start with a mixing bowl of
very cold water no hot water like the
package directions I'm going to add some
salt in an egg and I'm going to whisk
that in until it's completely combined
then we're going to add instant mashed
potatoes by the way I will have the
exact brand I used on food wishes calm
but this should work with almost
anything alright so after my instant
mashed potatoes were mixed in I did it
in two additions because I was
experimenting with the amounts but I did
perfect it so you will get the exact
measurements on food wishes all right so
that's what it looked like i flavored it
up with some fresh chopped chives some
black pepper and of course cayenne which
I spilled so got a little pink but it
tasted great
once our pancake mixture was made I put
a heavy high-quality nonstick skillet on
medium-high flame added oil and butter
then I'm going to divide the mixture
into four quarters and with wet hands
I'm going to shape those in the rough
patties don't worry about making a
perfect looking because nobody cares if
they're perfect except perfectionist and
nobody cares about them okay so just
flatten them out they're gonna look
awesome in the pan trust me
alright the butter has melted it's
starting to sizzle we're going to add
the pancakes to the pan turn the heat
down to medium and cook them for pretty
long time all right very important we
get a very well-developed crust on the
pancake all right besides the egg which
binds it a little bit it's that crust
that holds everything together so mine
went about 10 minutes at medium and you
can actually hear how crispy and crunchy
the bottom is by rubbing it like this
and also you know I wanted to touch
everybody's potato pancake alright I'm
going to flip those over and I'm going
to flatten those out a little bit
and the reason I'm flattening them out
is we're trying to maximize the crispy
crusty exterior and minimize the instant
mashed potato Center okay because the
more crisp we have the less these are
going to seem like we used up instant
mashed potatoes which is what we did so
that went about seven eight minutes on
the other side I transferred that to a
warm plate topped it with some sour
cream and some more fresh chives and it
was fantastic I could just feel that
crispy crust with the tip of my fork I
could not wait to dig into this what a
great way to use up some instant mashed
potatoes if you serve this to someone I
highly doubt anyone could tell you
didn't use it with leftover fresh when I
was a kid I loved getting mashed
potatoes as a side dish because I knew
the next day my mom was going to make
these fried mashed potato pancakes
she usually served them with eggs so I
really like this as a kid and this is
kind of my adult version using a random
leftover box of instant mashed potatoes
all right so it's not that crazy it's
only a little crazy and like I said at
the beginning this was just me playing
with some food to see what would happen
because it's fun to do so I don't know
maybe give these a try maybe not up to
you all the ingredients are on the site
as usual and as always enjoy
